result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Dennis Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by 10/21/17.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to/from Extended Supervision, but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.

**11-17-15/ Judge John Siefert**
The Court ordered that the defendant is granted 36 days of sentence credit
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No new retail theft municipal tickets.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 11-17-15 Court order granting 36 days of sentence credit
Court signed decision and order granting request for sentce credit in the amount of 36 days. Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.

Defendant Richard Dennis Larson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Richard Dennis Larson in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

 Statements by state, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  20 MONTHS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for ZERO  DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE YEAR AND ONE MONTH; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is SEVEN MONTHS.  Conditions of extended supervision: Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Is eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
*no new retail theft municipal tickets
*Pay all mandatory costs, fees  and surcharges by 10-21-17   to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to/from extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court via speaker phone, defendant Richard Dennis Larson not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense attorney out ill.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

 47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 10-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Dennis Larson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Richard Dennis Larson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.
